CatDescriptText: Cutline of image published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper February 1, 1947, pg. 13, reads: "Pastor's First Anniversary - The Metropolitan Baptist Church feted Rev. and Mrs. Spear on the occasion of closing their first year's administration as leader of the church. A large group of relatives and friends gathered to honor the Rev. Mr. Spear. Among them were the following ministers: Dr. T. J. King, the principal speaker; the Revs. W. W. Boone, B. S. Mason, S. G. Steveson, Clarence A. Burrell, J. Edward Keys, J. L. Dandridge and L. G. McLeod. Dr. C. E. McFadden served as toastmaster. Montgomery Evans and Raymond Wells were guest artists. Mrs. Rose Rushin of Philadelphia, the mother of Mrs. Spear, was present and a brother of Charles C. Rushin of Pittsburgh. - Photo by Harris."
TitMainTitle: Women and men gathered around banquet tables to celebrate first anniversary of Rev. Spear, in Metropolitan Baptist Church basement decorated with crepe paper streamers
